definition: public/collectively owned/common/international (e.g. high seas, metric system, calendar)/make public/fair/just/Duke, highest of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/honorable (gentlemen)/father-in-law/male (animal)

sentences.english: They are eager to buy their government bonds.
That sounds like good news for both equities and government bonds.
sentences.chinese: 对股票和政府公债来说，听起来是桩好事。

sentences.english: A debt-based security, like a bond, represents a loan for a set period of time.
sentences.chinese: 借贷证券，像是公债，相当于一种一段时间内的贷款。

sentences.english: Lately, some munis have offered tax-free yields of more than 6%.
sentences.chinese: 近来一些市政公债所提供的免税收益率超过6%。

sentences.english: Budget Law of China makes it clear, that local government is not permitted to issue public debts.
sentences.chinese: 我国《预算法》明文规定，不允许地方政府发行公债。

sentences.english: If we bring it into the funds, we shall maybe lose the principal and all.
sentences.chinese: 如果我们把它变做公债，我们也许会丧失本金和一切。

sentences.english: An adverse ruling from the court could roil the muni market.
sentences.chinese: 法庭颁布的不利条款也有可能扰乱市政公债市场。

sentences.english: It is said that the bonds will be retired in the near future.
sentences.chinese: 据说公债券不久将被收回。

sentences.english: That low-inflation outlook is indicated by the level of core European bond yields.
sentences.chinese: 而通货膨胀率的高低与否要视欧洲核心公债利率而定。

sentences.english: How on earth will you manage here, with your staggering levels of public and private debt?
sentences.chinese: 你们到底如何收拾你们惊人的公债和私债？

sentences.english: The Debt Services team uses DSS on a daily basis to service Bonds and other Debt.
sentences.chinese: 这个部门每天使用DSS进行公债和其它债务的服务。

sentences.english: In 1989, issued inflation-proof bonds for the first time.
sentences.chinese: 1989年，通过柜台销售方式首次发行保值公债。

sentences.english: The subscriber to a government loan has got higher interest than savings.
sentences.chinese: 公债认购者获得高于储蓄的利息。

sentences.english: They surrendered the lucrative bonds for no reason.
sentences.chinese: 他们莫名其妙地放弃了那些正在升值的公债。

definition: Central Bank of the Republic of China (Taiwan)
currency issued by Nationalist Government in 1948
currency issued by Nationalist Government in 1948
Fabi, first currency issued by the 國民黨|国民党[Guo2 min2 dang3] in 1935, in use until 1948
Border Region currency, issued by the Communist Border Region governments during the War against Japan and the War of Liberation
security (property held against a loan)/mortgaged property
